item.title: Graph Signal Processing for Global Stock Market Volatility Forecasting
item.description: arXiv:2410.22706v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The interconnectedness of global financial markets has brought increasing attention to modeling volatility spillover effects. Via incorporating Graph Signal Processing techniques, a novel multivariate framework, extending the traditional Heterogeneous Auto-Regressive model, is developed in the spectral domain constructed by the graph Fourier transformation method. Further, a set of convolution filters with learnable weights is employed to more flexibly aggregate the past mid-term and long-term information. Using 24 global stock market indices, the effectiveness of the proposed model is demonstrated through comprehensive empirical evaluations.
